ImageFileIO

Method Detail

OpenImage

public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage OpenImage()
Creates an OpenFile dialog box, then returns a BufferedImage from the image in the file.

Returns:
BufferedImage img- contains only the RGB information, returns null and prints any exceptions if the file is unable to be opened.

OpenImageIM

public static edu.tamut.IP.ImageUtils.nImage OpenImageIM()
Creates an OpenFile dialog box, then returns an nImage Object containing the selected file and the BufferedImage from the file.

Returns:
nImage img- An nImage object which encapsulates a BufferedImage containing the RGB information from the file, and the file itself, returns null and prints any exceptions if the file is unable to be opened.

DisplayImage

public static void DisplayImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
Draws the inputted image to a JFrame component. This is best used without a GUI for debugging purposes as it cannot be parented.

Parameters:
img - BufferedImage to be displayed.

ReturnDisplayImage

public static javax.swing.JFrame ReturnDisplayImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
Not ready yet, do not use.

Parameters:
img - BufferedImage to be displayed.
Returns:
Hidden (work in progress)

SaveImageAs

public static void SaveImageAs(java.awt.image.BufferedImage inputImage)
Creates a SaveAs dialog box and attempts to save the image to the selected file location.

Parameters:
inputImage - BufferedImage to be saved to a file, returns null and prints any exceptions if the image cannot be saved.
